meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a system of government or management by a single ruler or authority.
meanings.sent1: The monocratic leader made all the decisions without consulting anyone else.
meanings.sent2: In a monocratic regime, the ruler's word is law.
meanings.sent3: The monocratic manager insisted on choosing the office paint color alone.
meanings.sent4: Her monocratic approach to project management left no room for collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The monocratic nature of the company's hierarchy stifled creativity and innovation.

meanings.definition: Exercising complete control or power over a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The monocratic CEO had the final say in all company matters.
meanings.sent2: The monocratic supervisor micromanaged every aspect of the team's work.
meanings.sent3: It was a monocratic decision to change the office layout overnight.
meanings.sent4: The monocratic grip of the dictator tightened over the nation.
meanings.sent5: Her monocratic leadership style alienated many team members.
